verses.roman:
ethā mahāprabhu yadi nīlādri calilā
nirjana vana-pathe yāite mahā sukha pāilā

synonyms: ethā—on the other side; mahāprabhu—Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu; yadi—when; nīlādri calilā—went back to Jagannātha Purī; nirjana vana-pathe—on a solitary forest path; yāite—traveling; mahā sukha pāilā—got very great pleasure.
translation: When Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu returned to Jagannātha Purī, He passed through the solitary forest, and He received great pleasure in doing so.
